intro: Sterculia bammleri, commonly known as the African cherry or African nut tree, is a tropical tree native to Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant produces woody pods that contain edible seeds, which are often used in traditional medicine and as a food source. Its bark and leaves are also valued for their medicinal properties, including anti-inflammatory and antimalarial effects. Sterculia bammleri thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often found in lowland forests.
